did.abstract: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal Radical Philosophy Review, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, websites, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated in 2009 by Richard A. Jones on behalf of the Radical Philosophy Association; additional materials were donated in 2010 and 2011.

http://home.grandecom.net/~jackgm/RPA.html was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of The California Digital Library's Web Archiving Service in 2008 as part of the Other Left Activism Web Archive. In 2012, http://www.radicalphilosophyassociation.org/ was added to the web archive. In 2015, these websites were migrated to Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. In 2018, https://www.rpamag.org/ was added to the web archive. The accession number associated with this website is 2019.106.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Select financial documents, mostly from conference registration, were appraised and destroyed, based on the presence of sensitive personal information and a relative lack of evidential, intrinsic, or informational value.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The RPA also publishes the journal Radical Philosophy Review.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The Alternative Press Center held these records until 2009 when it donated them to the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives. The Radical Philosophy Association allowed the Tamiment Library/Wagner Labor Archives to take possession of these items in 2009 and sent additional materials in 2010. A poster for the 9th Biennial Conference was donated in 2010 and found in repository.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2014, the archived websites were added as a series. In 2019, an additional website was added to the finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The records relate to both the Radical Philosophy Association and to its journal Radical Philosophy Review, and contain correspondence, minutes, typescripts, websites, conference materials membership and financial materials, and printed ephemera and other internal documents related to its political activism, including within the American Philosophical Association.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Photographs and slides were separated from this collection and established as the Radical Philosophy Association Photographs and Slides (PHOTOS 272).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any copyright held by the Radical Philosophy Association were transferred to New York University in 2009 by Richard A. Jones. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.

appraisal.head: Take Down Policy
appraisal.p: Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the repository email.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Founded in 1982, the Radical Philosophy Association is an international organization whose members struggle against capitalism, racism, sexism, homophobia, disability discrimination, environmental ruin, and all other forms of domination, drawing upon a variety of radical traditions including phenomenology, Marxism, anarchism, post-structuralism, post-colonial theory and environmentalism. Its efforts center on conferences and publications. The website contains their newsletter, call for papers, information on their upcoming and previous conferences, and press releases and statements on Angela Davis, Academic Freedom, Afghanistan, Iraq, Anti-Intervention Project, Colombia, and anti-racism. The RPA also publishes the journal Radical Philosophy Review. The collection also includes the website for their online publication, RPA Mag.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: New site crawls are accrued semiannually.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Crawl was limited to domains and subdomains of radicalphilosophyassociation.org and rpamag.org in order to remain within the collection scope and data constraints.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to technical or privacy issues, archived websites may not be exact copies of the original website at the time of the web crawl. Certain file types will not be captured dependent on how they are embedded in the site. Other parts of websites that the crawler has difficulty capturing includes Javascript, streaming content, database-driven content, and highly interactive content. Full-Text searches of archived websites are available at https://archive-it.org/organizations/567.
